alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 1:14AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Patchy Freezing Fog possible for portions of the Tennessee Valley overnight.. Clear skies, calm conditions, residual moisture from recent heavy rainfall, and temperatures falling to and below freezing could lead to the development of fog and freezing fog. This moisture could also freeze on elevated surfaces such as bridges and overpasses, creating potentially dangerous driving conditions. Portions of Franklin, DeKalb, Jackson, and Marshall counties could be impacted by freezing fog. Conditions should improve after daybreak, as warmer temperatures and mixing help dissipate fog and melt any ice that forms. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet, for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service in Huntsville.
